str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To soil, stain, pollute, defile, lit. and met. Probably from melas; to soil.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Of unknown origin; a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From a compound of apo and archomai; a beginning of sacrifice, i.e. The first-fruit.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
